Theme: The purpose of this book is to provide readers with information related to design, development, delivery, management, and evaluation aspects of WBI.

Title: Virtual Realism
Theme: In Virtual Realism the author explains the technology of virtual reality, examines several new art forms, and suggest ways of adapting the technology to create a more balanced life.

Title: Web-Teaching: A Guide to Designing Interactive Teaching for the World Wide Web
Theme: This book can help you develop and apply interactive, multimedia, educational materials by way of the Web and its wealth of knowledge.

Title: Virtual Reality: A Door to Cyberspace
Theme: This book looks at the development of virtual reality and considers a potential and its problems. The author raises some important questions: Does VR promote violence? Could this technology become a form of mind control? Could it make us less human and more like machines? Could it become a threat to our very way of life?

Title: The Unified Modeling Language User Guide
Theme: In this book, the original developers of the Unified Modeling Language (UML) - Grady Booch, James Rambaugh, and Ivar Jacobson - provide a tutorial to the core aspects of the language in-a-two-color format dfesigned to facilitate learning.

Title: Using Communications Media in Open Learning (Open and Distance Learning Series)

Title: Improving Your Students' Learning: Reflections on the Experience of Study
Theme: The basic tenet of this book is that the quality of teaching and learning in distance and open learning can be significantly enhanced through a detailed understanding of how students really go about their studies.

Title: Flexible Learning in Higher Education
Flexible Learning in Higher Education
Theme: Themes covered fall into the three categories of broad institutional issues in flexible learning, case studies from individual departments, and the student view of flexible learning.

Title: Failure to Connect: How Computers Affect Our Children's Minds - for Better and Worse
Theme: In this book the author questions whether computers are really helping or harming children's development. It id the first book to link children's technology use to important new findings about stages of child development and brain maturation, which area clearly explained throughout.

Theme: The scope of guideline G3 is to: Summarise the international standards concerning multimedia services in the core network, used in different ACTS projects. / Idendify evolutionary paths for the core network, so that it can efficiently support the provision of advanced multimedia services to residential users / Systematically assemble the various technical approaches, used in the SII projects, for the evolution of the core network in relation to the support of advanced multimedia services. / Compile them in a consistent document that will provide the target readers with necessary information for their strategic and product planning.

Title: SII Chain Guideline G4: "Organisation of Advanced Communications Services Trials with Residential Users"
Theme: This guideline is based on the results of the ACTS SII Chain, which includes the majority of ACTS projects carrying out trials with residential users. This guideline aims to identify the critical success factors of implementation of residential users trials of multimedia services and applications.

Title: Microsoft Press Το λεξικό της Πληροφορικής
Theme: Λεξικό για υπολογιστές (τρίτη αμερικανική έκδοση): Πάνω από 7.600 λήμματα / Περισσότεροι από 2.300 νέοι όροι και ορισμοί / 345 εικόνες και σχήματα / Εκτεταμένη κάλυψη του Internet και του Ιστού (Web).

Title: SII Chain Guideline G5: "Internet in the MultiMedia Scenario"
Theme: This guideline starts an analysis on the effectiveness of the effectiveness by which (multimedia) applications developed and offered over Internet can be exploited by Multimedia Users, and, on the contrary, which new evolution of Internet applications is possible given the Multimedia infrastructure available at user premises and in the delivery access subsystem.

Title: SII Chain Guideline G1: "State of the Art and Evolution of Relevant Standards"
Theme: This draft guideline constitutes a reference document for the standards and for the standardisation activites relevant to multimedia communication. Specifically the document presents an overview of the standardisation bodies active in this sector, and of their specific areas of work.

Theme: The objective of this guideline is to give an overview of some evolution scenario's of today's telecommunication networks and to provide consequent recommendations for the implementation of interactive advanced broadband services.

Title: SII Chain Guideline G11: "Requirements on Set-Top Boxes"
Theme: This guideline has the objective to help service providers and network operators to integrate future oriented specifications in their requirements of set top boxes. Set Top Boxes are expected to be low cost devices but with a great degree of evolution flexibility such as supporting a variety of applications, operating with different types of accessnetworks, interfacing with a various number of devices and with ease-of-use features as effective interfaces to users.

Title: EURORIM
Theme: The EURORIM project is part of the SII Chain and provides Logistic and Technical support for the development of guidelines, acting to build consensus among the SII projects, to identify common positions, to integrate the results of the individual projects in an coherent picture. The SII (Interactive Multimedia Service) Chain addresses the issues related to the provision of interactive multimedia services towards residential users.

Title: EURORIM SII  Chain  Guidelines
Theme: Summaries of the SII Chain Guidelines

Title: SII Chain Guideline G9: "Electronic Commerce"
Theme: The scope of this guideline is to support the development of electronic Commerce. The main Objectives of the proposed guideline are to provide an analysis and assessment of the technical and marketing aspects related to EC with special emphasis to broadband Access.

Title: SII Chain Guideline G10: "Provision of Multimedia Services Using IP over Bearer Networks"
Theme: This guideline looks at the provision of services, including multimedia services, over an IP suite based application network, supported over telecom bearer networks. Special attention is given to switched telecom networks in particular ATM based Networks.

Theme: This is a book about the nature of machines. Undermining the distictions between technology and nature, George  Dyson Chronicles the evolution of collective mechanical intelligence-on a level of trancending our own.

Theme: Usability engineering helps make computer systems easier to use and more relevant to business needs. Usable computer systems save time and money for industrial organisations and increase user satisfaction and productivity. There is still little information about how to put methods and techniques for usability engineeering in a commercial environment into practice .

Theme: This monograph offers a solid foundation in understanding the availability and imporatnce of instrumented gait analysis systems and how they work. Also covered are organisational issues related to the implementation of Usability Engineering, including cost justification, project planning, and organisational structures.

Title: Procedural Elements for Computer Graphics
Theme: The second edition of this classic computer graphics book represents a major rewrite. Major new additions include graphical user interfaces, ellipse, image compression and antialiased line aldorithms.

Title: Gerontechnology
Theme: The present volume is concerned with gerontechnology - the study of technology and ageing with the aim of improving the functioning of older people in daily life. The Second International Conference on Gerontechnology with the subtitle "A sustainable investment in the future" was held in helsinki in October 1996 under the auspices of COST-A5 "Ageing and Technology" and STAKES, the Finnish National Research and Development centre for Welfare and Health.

Title: The Design of Children's Technology
Theme: This book brings together current discussions of how and why new technologies are being designed. It presents innovative methods, techniques and ideas, making this a unique resource for developers of children's software, hardware, and multimedia products; graphic/human interface designers; and university faculty doing research in the area of children and technology.

Title: Human Factors and Voice Interactive Systems
Theme: This book highlights the importance of human factors in speech technologies and presents and demostrates the use of human factors principles, methods, techniques, and tools in the design of speech-enabled applications.

Title: Society, The endless frontier: A European vision of research and innovation policies for the 21st century
Theme: In this study the authors describe the economic and geopolitical background againgst which the European research effort is proceeding, particularly in view of the emergence of new powers in Asia; they describe the way in which the Fifth Framework Programme is endeavouring to take account of the new developments between research and the various facets of social activity, in order to equip Europe with the level and Quality of research it needs.

Title: Handbook of Internet and Multimedia Systems and Applications
Theme: This companion to the author's Handbook of Multimedia Computing probes the development of systems supporting Internet and multimedia applications. Areas explored include: Internet radio and television broadcasting; Video-on-demand; World Wide Web applications, Mobile multimedia systems; Digital libraries.

Title: Handbook on Multimedia Computing
Handbook on Multimedia Computing
Handbook on Multimedia Computing
Theme: Handbook on Multimedia Computing provides a comprehensive resource on advanced topics in this field, cond\sidered here as the integration of four industries: computer, communication, broadcasting/entertainment, and consumer electronics. This indispensable reference compilescontributions from 80 academic and industry leaders, examining all the major subsets of multimedia activity.

Title: Producing Web Pages that Everyone Can Access: A COST 219bis Guidebook
Theme: These Web accessibility guidelines are a compilation of existing information sources and documents, mainly of the findings of the TIDE-Harmony project (DE 1226) and the current version of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). W3C is currently the de facto standardisation body in matters relating to the Internet. Since 1996, a special working group, called Web Access Initiative (WAI), takes care of the needs of disabled Internet Users. Many of their Web author guidelines have been incorporated in this text. Available at http://www.stakes.fi/cost219/webdesign

Title: Design Guidelines on Smart Homes: A COST 219bis Guidebook
Theme: This booklet gives a brief overview of several aspects of smart home technology, particularly when applied to people with special needs. This document is targeted at local authorities and emergency and care service providers for whom smart home technology may provide a socially desirable, efficient and cost-effective way of providing home-care services. It is also targeted  at the manufacturers, designers, architects and engineers of smart homes in an effort to raise awareness of the requirements of older and disabled people.

Title: New Ways of Using Video Telephony: A COST 219bis Guidebook
Theme: This booklet presents some basic facts that will hopefully increase the understanding of the possibilities for implementing viedophone equipment and services that are of use to disabled people.

Title: Accessibility Requirements for New Telecommunication Equipment: A COST 219bis Guidebook
Theme: The adoption of user centred design methodologies could be most beneficial for the designer of  new telecommunication equipment and increase acceptance by all users. Addressing the needs of elderly and the disabled persons.

Title: Text telephony for deaf, hearing impaired, deaf-blind and speech impaired people: A joint COST 219bis and NFTH/NSH Guidebook
Theme: With this document the desire and aim is to throw light on the importance of text telephones, as an aid for deaf, hearing impaired, deaf-blinf and speech impaired people. The aim is also to prevent delusion, that no special text telephones or standards are needed regarding text telephony.

Title: The Productive Information Society: A Basis for Sustainability
Theme: An abstract of this paper appears in the Proceedings of the 5th International ERCIM Workshop on User Interfaces for All, held at Dagstuhl, Germany, from November 28 to December 1, 1999.

Title: Future Media Use in the Private Sector
Theme: Expert interview study of the Farounhofer Institute System and innovation Research in co-operation with and sponsored by Medien padagosischer Forschungsverbund Sudwest. It is a survey among media experts conducted in Ffebruary and March of 1998. Experts were asked to make projections of the future developments of media usage behaviour, network technology and end user equipment, as well as market developments for a time horizon until 2005.

Title: User Acceptance of Health Telematics Applications: Education and Training in Health Telematics
Theme: This book contains the presentations of the participants of the 2nd European Workshop on Acceptance of Telematics Applications by Healthcare Professionals, "Education and Training in Health Telematics". The contributions describe on the current health telematics education programmes offered in universities, the  continuing education programmes and the new ideas in training for the "just in time" learning

Title: CHI 2000 The Future is Here: Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
Theme: The Hague, The Netherlands, 1-6 April 2000. The annual CHI conference in the premier worlwide forum for the exchange of information an all aspects of how people interact with computers. The theme of CHI 2000, The Future is Here poses a number of questions for the fiels including: What is the best interactive experience beyond desktop ? How do we best leverage what we know about human perception, cognition and motor skills in the future technology design ? What guidelines and lessons for the future are emerging in the research areas of input devices, CSCW, visualisation and mobile computing. Topics include: New interaction technologies, Intelligent agents, 3D user interfaces, The home, Computer supported cooperativework, Information visualisation, Information retrieval, Children & computing, Computer supported cooperative lerning, Computer mediated communication, Augmented reality, Empirical studies, Hand-held devices, Mobile computing, HCI and social issues, Multi-modal interaction, Speech & voice, Auditory input / output, Virtual reality

Title: CHI 2000 Extended Abstracts: Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems
Theme: The Hague, The Netherlands, 1-6 April 2000. The annual CHI conference in the premier worlwide forum for the exchange of information an all aspects of how people interact with computers. The theme of CHI 2000, The Future is Here poses a number of questions for the fiels including: What is the best interactive experience beyond desktop ? How do we best leverage what we know about human perception, cognition and motor skills in the future technology design ? What guidelines and lessons for the future are emerging in the research areas of input devices, CSCW, visualisation and mobile computing.

Title: Social Navigation of Information Space
Theme: Social navigation is a vibrant new fiela which examines how we navigate onformation spaces in "real" nad "virtual" environments, how we orient and guide ourselves, and how we interact with others to find our way. This approach brings a new way of thinking about how we design information spaces, emphasising our need to collaborate with others, and follow the trails of their activities in these spaces. Among the themes are: the nature and definitions of social navigation, studies of work and the physical word in terms of social navigation, affordances of spaces with support social navigation and sociality, examples of new technologies with support social navigation

Title: Robots for Kinds: Exploring New technologies for Learning
Theme: Within the scope of children's learning and play, the concept of ropot and the application of actual robots are undergoing a dramatic expansion. Here the term "robot" referes to a growing range of interactive devices-including toys, pets, assistants to the disabled, and overtly educationsl tools-which are being used in ways that are expected to have profound and beneficial effects how our children develop and grow.

Title: Information Appliances and Beyond: Interaction Design for Consumer Products
Theme: Information appliances and other interactive products "beyond the desktop" present user interface design challenges that are only beginning to be understood. In this one-of-a-kind- book, interaction designers examine the issues they confronted in their projects: Microsoft Windows CE, a vehicle navigation system, interactive children's toys and more. You 'll enjoy reading their engaging and sometimes suprisising stories, but more important, you 'll gain insights that will benefit your own design and development work.

Title: Design for Multimedia Learning
Theme: The multimedia revolution has created exciting opportunities for education and training. It has also posed a central challenge - how o enhance the process of learning to meet the demands of the new information society. Good design to meet this challenge requires a deep understanding of learning and a mastery of the new multimedia technologies. This book provides a lucid comprehensive introduction to the dynamic emerging field of educational multimedia design.

Title: The Humane Interface: New Directions for Designing Interactive Systems
Theme: This unique guide to interactive system design reflects the experience and vision of Jef Raskin, the creator of the Apple Macintosh project. Other books may show how to use today's widgets and interface ideas effectively. Raskin, however, demonstrates that many current interface paradigms are dead ends, and that making computers significantly easier to use requires new approaches. He explains how to effect desperately needed changes, offering a wealth of innovative and specific interface ideas for software designers, developers, and product managers.

Title: The Computer in the Visual Arts
Theme: The widely praised introduction to computer graphics focuses on the computer as a medium for artistic expression and graphic communication. It is the first comprehensive work to combine technical and theoritical aspects of the emerging field of computer art and design.

Title: Effective Web Animation: Advances Techniques for the Web
Theme: This book will bring you up-to-date with the latest tools and methods for creating eye-catching animation that won't clog band-width space or take forever to download. This book provides an overview of computer animation techniques and in-depth information on producing complex-yet efficient-animation using tools such as GIF, javascript, and Macromedia Flash. In particular, the text focuses on methods for minimizing file size and techniques for reducing time spent on the tedious process of creating individual frames.

Title: Design , Specification and Verification of Interactive Systems '99
Theme: This book is the formal proceedings of the Eurographics Workshop on Design, Specification and Verification of Interactive Systems, DSV-IS '99, which was held at the University of Minho, Braga, Potrugal, 2-4 June 1999. The collection of papers in this volume covers specification methods and their use in design, model-based tool support, task and dialogue models, distributed collaboration and models for virtual  reality input. Strong emphasis is laid on formal represenations and modelling techniques and their use in understanding interaction and informing the design of artefacts.

Title: New Methods of Work and Electronic Commerce
Theme: This is the first overview of the projects that Key Action on New Methods of work and Electronic Commerce in the Information Society Technology (IST) programme will support. It brings together information on the outcome of the first call for Proposals, and an overview of the selected projects, dfollowed by the description of the evolution of the Workprogramme for 2000.

Title: Status Report on European Telework: New Methods of Work 1999
Theme: This publication includes updated information on the latest developments and initiatives, in European Research Programmes, Structural Funds and the Support measures for trans European Networks. It also contains the highlights of the European benchmarking survey, illustrated by country overviews of main issues in telework uptake

Title: Designing for an aging population
Theme: The purpose of this collection is to Provide easy access to important research about the ways in which systems, tools, and environments can be improved for optimum use by older adults. The papers included here provide an in-depth look at the empirical studies of human factors and aging that have been conducted in the last decade.

Title: Proceedings of the Human Factors and Ergonomics Society 41st Annual Meeting 1997 (Volume 1)
Theme: This two-volume proceedings contains articles and abstracts of papers presented at the HFES 41st annual Meeting, held in Albuquerque, in 1997.

Title: Proceedings of the Human Factors and Ergonomics Society 41st Annual Meeting 1997 (Volume 2)
Theme: This two-volume proceedings contains articles and abstracts of papers presented at the HFES 41st Annual Meeting, held in Albuquerque, in 1997.

Title: Genetic Programming: On the Programming of Computers by Means of Natural Selection
Theme: This book addresses the problem of getting computers to learn to program themselves by providing a domain-independent way to search the space of possible computer programs for a program that solves a given problem. Genetic Programming contains many worked examples and includes a sample computer code that will allow readers to run their own programs.

Title: The Practice of Programming
Theme: This book is full of practical advice and real-world examples in C, C++, Java, and a variety of special-purpose languages. It includes chapters on: debugging, testing, performance, portability, design, interfaces, style, notation.

The design decisions, adaptation methods, and experience presented in this book are a unique source of ideas and techniques for developing more usable and more intelligent web-based systems suitable for a great varuiety of users.

Title: From Animals to Animats 3: Proceedings of the Third International Conference on Simulation of Adaptive Behavior
Theme: These proceedings contain 58 papers presented at the Third International conference on Simulation of Adaptive Behavior (SAB94), providing comprehensive and up-to-date sources on an exciting new approach to understanding intelligence: the simulation and construction of artificial animals. The conference took place in Brighton , England, during August 8th - 12th 1994.

Title: From Animals to Animats 4: Proceedings of the Fourth International Conference on Simulation of Adaptive Behavior
Theme: The papers in this book were presented at the Fourth International Conference on Simulation of Adaptive Behavior (SAB96), held at North Falmouth, Cape Cod, Masschusetts, USA, ON September 9-13, 1996. The objective of the biennial SAB conferences is to bring together researchersfrom a wide range of backgrounds to further our understanding of the behaviors and unerlying mechanisms that allow natural and artificial animals ('animats') to adapt and survive in uncertain environments.
